data.title: Move Flap-Or-Die Sample Content

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
The content of the [Flap-Or-Die Sample package](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/tree/master/SampleProjects/FlapOrDie) is located in the [Data root directory](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/tree/master/SampleProjects/FlapOrDie/Content/Data). It needs to be moved into a subfolder that is named after the sample package, so users can safely install multiple sample packages at once, without them accidentally overwriting each other's content.

@SirePi This one might be for you - do you have time to fix this? If you do, also remember to update the [.nuspec](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/master/NuGetPackageSpecs/FlapOrDie.Sample.nuspec) file with a new version number and dependency versions (need to match the latest binary release) so the automated build process is able to build and deploy a new release for your package.

data.title: Deal with Large Files in Git History

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Due to some early mistakes in the project, the full repository is somewhat around 300 MB big. If there is a safe way to do this, this should be fixed.
- The complete history of the repository should be preserved.
- All commit IDs should remain the same.
- Forks on GitHub need to be unaffected.
- All that should be done is replacing the data of the affected files with zero-length dummy files. They should still remain in place. If possible, replacing them with "REMOVED" plain-text is preferable.
- This needs to be done in a safe way.

No experiments. Any insights on how to do this with git and GitHub appreciated.

data.title: Flap or die update

data.title: Revisit the "New Project" Dialog

milestone.title: Learning Curve
milestone.description: Improving the documentation of Duality and making it easier for new users to use and join the project.

data.body:
The "New Project" dialog in its current form is mostly a relic from the pre-"Package Management" era.
- Creating a new project doesn't mix well with the Package Manager, which re-downloads all packages.
- There's the entire codebase for project templates, which is mostly obsolete now that Package Management is around.
- It cannot distinguish between the original set of plugins and third-party plugins. It doesn't have a concept of packages.

Consider removing it entirely - or replacing it with something better.

data.title: Ease Cursor Lag (VSync Active) with Better System Cursor Support

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Input lag is a known problem when VSync is active, simply because it may take from 16 to 33 ms between the detection of an input signal by the OS to displaying the results ingame on screen. There's not really much that can be done about that.

However, in the especially obvious case of mouse cursor lag, the effects can be concealed by using the system mouse cursor instead of a custom rendered one. This is already possible, but the default system cursor isn't a great visual choice for most games.
- Add backend API to specify the cursor image to use with a configured `PixelData` sprite.
  - Don't add this to `INativeWindow`, because it should also work in the editor. There needs to be a central API for that.
  - Consider adding it to the `IGraphicsBackend` directly, with the actual backend implementations pulling from there internally.
- Update the BasicMenu sample to only render the ingame cursor when the system cursor is inactive. Also add a neat custom cursor sprite for the system cursor.

data.title: Flap or die sample
data.body: Full game, highscore management

data.title: Allow adding Components to multiple selected GameObjects

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Right now, you can only add components to one GameObject at a time. It gets tiring when, for example, you change a Component class's namespace and have to re-add it to different GameObjects.

It would be much easier when you can add Components to selected GameObjects in the same way as it is done right now.

data.title: Generated projects have System namespace references

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
I noticed that the plugin projects (at least CorePlugin) generated by Duality have explicit references to the System namespace (System and System.Xml.Linq, to be specific).

It was mentioned in the Duality 1.x to 2.0 upgrade guide ([here](http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?f=17&t=557)) that we should remove all of these explicit references.

Removing these references seem to have no detrimental effects, as my code compiles cleanly without them.

milestone.title: v2.0
milestone.description: "Coming Soon" Stuff that would introduce too many or too severe breaking changes to be released in anything less than a major version step.

data.title: Consider Fixing NuSpecs to Match NuGet 3.0

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
As stated [here](https://docs.nuget.org/Create/uwp-create), NuGet 3.0 no longer allows packages to add libraries to the `lib` root directory. 

This isn't an issue for Duality itself, but it might be when someone chooses to install Duality packages in a regular VS solution. While unlikely for plugins, this is a likely use case for plugin developers to obtain the Duality core binaries in a plugin solution.

Test whether the Duality Package Manager can handle libraries inside a `lib/target` folder and consider updating all nuspecs according to this. Do so in the course of [creating the v2.0 packages](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/issues/206).

data.title: Prevent the editor from going automatically fullscreen

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Again another small gripe I have.
The Duality editor goes fullscreen on launch every time I open it. It gets annoying after a time.
It would be best to have it open in windowed mode, at least for me. Maybe make it a configurable option?
I hope it'll be a small fix and won't take much time and effort. If not, this can be ignored until it can be done.

P.S: I didn't want to make this a separate issue because it would be overly pedantic of me, but I notice that the automatically-generated AssemblyInfo files have German comments. It would be best to replace them with their English counterparts, I think. Sorry, it's just one small thing I noticed.

data.title: Generated CorePlugin has mixed tabs and spaces

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
The auto-generated CorePlugin.cs file by the Duality Editor contains mixed tabs and spaces.
I use Productivity Power Tools, which pops up a prompt asking me to Tabify and Untabify everytime I open it up.
I propose modifying the auto-generated file to either use tabs or spaces exclusively, instead of interchangeably.

data.title: Shaders sample
data.body: Shader sample draft

data.title: Get Rid of Deprecated OpenGL 2.1 Functionality

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
The default Duality backend still uses a lot of builtin / fixed function API in OpenGL 2.1. Get rid of it in order to prepare a future upgrade of the OpenGL version, as well as to provide a better sample implementation for OpenGL ES backends.

**Things to address:**
- Don't use any builtin shader variables.
- Don't use any pre-specified vertex attributes.
- ~Switch namespaces and use OpenTK's ES API, rather than the regular GL API. (If possible)~ _Edit:_ Doesn't work that way - OpenGL ES may not be available on desktop platforms even if they offer a superset of its features.
- In general, don't use anything that isn't in GL ES 2.1 [according to the docs](http://docs.gl/).

This should probably be addressed in conjunction with the [Vertex Transform change](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/issues/219).

data.title: Move Camera Vertex Transform to GPU

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
Right now, parts of the vertex transformation in rendering happens on the CPU using `PreprocessCoords` or manually:
- Transforming world coordinates to camera coordinates
- Applying object-local scale depending on camera distance
- Rotating the object locally around its center

This approach **has several problems**:
- Typical GPU work is done on the CPU with poor performance.
- Vertex Shaders never have access to the original world coordinates of a vertex and cannot adjust or react to them in a meaningful way.

But it also **solves the following problem**:
- The fake perspective that is used in parallax 2D projection requires to scale objects around their local center / origin. No global transformation can properly transform all incoming vertices at once, so a per-object transformation is required. However, per-object uniform data would prevent efficient batch rendering and actually make performance worse.

If there is a way to solve this using a GPU vertex transform approach, there's no reason not to move all vertex transform calculations to the GPU for better shader support and performance. Customized solutions could still be implemented using custom shaders.

data.title: Add Implicit Shader Uniforms

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
As discussed [here](http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?p=3232#p3232), the graphics backend should automatically set certain shader uniform variables, if a shader defines them.

Candidates for this:
- Useful for Effects
  - `GameTime`, in seconds, as a `float`
  - `RealTime`, in seconds, as a `float`
- Diagnostics
  - `FrameCount`, as an `int`
  - `BatchIndex`, as an `int`
  - `MaterialIndex`, as an `int`
- Others?

Also, it would be worth considering whether a generic way to define these builtin uniforms would make sense. Ideally, they would be defined in the frontend and applied in the backend.

data.title: Menu sample extended
data.body: Extended the basic menu sample with another menu, used to show the interaction with something more interactive like a volume control

data.title: ContentProvider Support for Resource Packages

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
As mentioned by @SirePi [here](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/issues/93#issuecomment-58672672), it would be nice to have a way of packaging together Resources in a container single file. This could be implemented easily in the `ContentProvider` class.
- Introduce a Resource Package file format (file extension `.rpk` maybe?), which is essentially a disguised `.zip` as usable by `System.IO.Compression`.
- Any package file is treated as a virtual directory, which can be addressed as usual with path strings.
  - The file `Data\SomeDir.rpk` would be treated the same as `Data\SomeDir`.
  - The Resource path `Data\SomeDir\SomeTex.Texture.res` would work all the same, regardless of whether `SomeDir` is a directory, or a `SomeDir.rpk` package file.
- Provide a `LoadPackage` method that allows to load all Resources inside a Resource path.
  - It shouldn't matter whether `Data\SomeDir` actually resolved to a package file or a directory.

Reflect on this and its implications a bit more until implementing. This is a non-breaking addition to the framework. No need for pre-v2.0 implementation.

data.title: Allow empty directories with the same name as the new project to be used as the project directory

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body: Should fix #214

data.title: Empty directories with the same name as the project name should be valid

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
- Create a folder in `Documents\Duality Projects\`, name it TestProject.
- Open up Dualitor, and choose to create a new project.
- Name it TestProject, and select the recently created folder.
- Dualitor will throw an error saying that the new project target directory already exists.

Instead of just saying the directory isn't valid, Dualitor should check if the target directory isn't empty. If it is empty, the directory should be valid.

Should be pretty easy to implement.
